attributes.action: MPs should not be allowed to vote on a bill which does not affect the country which contains their constituency.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, Scottish, Welsh and Northern Irish MPs in Westminster are able to vote on bills and policies which affect only residents of England, or England and Wales, or some other subset of the population (e.g. tuition fees.) By signing this petition, you agree that MPs should only be able to vote on a bill if the bill affects their constituents.
